result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan L. Bruch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already done.
Complete AODA assessment at discretion of agent.
Follow through with treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Counseling agent feels beneficial.
Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 3:21 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Dylan L. Bruch in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Dylan L. Bruch.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 20-CF-105, 21-CF-68, 22-CF-35 and 22-CF-89.  Plea agreement.  State has no additions or corrections to revocation packet.  Def.'s Atty. has no corrections to revocation packet.  22-CF-89/Plea to Cts. 1 and 2, DRI 3 and 4.  22-CF-35/DRI Ct. 1, plea to Ct. 2, DRI 3.  21-CF-68/DRI.   Joint recommendation:  22-CF-89/30 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision, DNA sample and surcharge, AODA & follow through, absolute sobriety, employment, counseling.  State does not object to eligibility for Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration programs.  Ct. 2 - 30 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision, costs, DNA, same conditions.  22-CF-35/Ct. 2 - 30 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision, concurrent.  20-CF-105/18 months initial confinement and 12 months extended supervision, concurrent, same conditions.  22-CF-89 & 22-CF-35/Def. advised of right to preliminary hearing.  Waiver of preliminary hearing form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  Def. waives preliminary.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds cases over.  Information - Def.'s Atty. has copy.  Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  22-CF-89/Ct. 1 - no contest plea.  Ct. 2 - no contest plea.  22-CF-35/Ct. 2 - no contest plea.  Court grants States motion to DRI for sentencing purposes:  22-CF-35/Cts. 1 and 3.  21-CF-68/Ct. 1.  22-CF-89/Cts. 3 and 4.  Court advises Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds pleas entered freely and voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of 22-CF-89/Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  22-CF-35/Ct. 2.  Sentencing remarks by State.  Sentencing remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Def. makes statement to Court.  Court orders:  22-CF-89/Ct. 1 - 4 1/2 years prison, 30 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision, costs, DNA surcharge, complete AODA assessment at discretion of agent, follow through with treatment, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain employment, counseling agent feels beneficial.  Ct. 2 - same sentence as Ct. 1.  22-CF-35/Ct. 2 same sentence as in 22-CF-89.  20-CF-105/Ct. 1 - 2 1/2 years prison, 18 months initial confinement, 12 months extended supervision, same conditions as in 22-CF-89.  Any outstanding obligation in 20-CF-105 converted to civil judgment.  All sentences concurrent to each other.  Credit - 20-CF-105/ 166 days.  21-CF-68/0 days.  22-CF-35 and 22-CF-89/125 days.  Def. is eligible for the Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration Programs.  Def. advised of voting and firearm rights.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  DNA sample unless already done.

Court calls 22CF89 & 22CF35, 21CF68 @ 02:09 PM Defendant Dylan L. Bruch in court with attorney John Zich appears via zoom.  Defendant Dylan L. Bruch in custody, via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Dylan L. Bruch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Zich is appearing special.  Atty Zich waives time limits for p.h on 22Cf89 & 22CF35. Def. agrees to waive time limts for p.h.  Court accepts waiver. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court calls 22CF35, 22CF89 & 21CF68 @ 02:51 PM Defendant Dylan L. Bruch in court, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 22CF89 & 22CF35 set for AIA and 21CF68 set for Status. Court reviews history of cases. Def. is eligible for P.D. and is still waiting for PD to be appointed. Bond continues  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No driving without a valid driver's license.

01:09 PM in Room 301.  22CF89, 22CF35, 21CF68. Defendant Dylan L. Bruch in court, in custody, at Langlade County Jail.  Defendant appears by video means.  Kelly Hays appears for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. advised of charges and penalties on 22CF89.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like PD. State asks that bond cover all three cases. Def. advised of charges, penalties on older cases. Def. has copy of criminal complaints. State heard on bond, recommends $10,000 cash bond to cover all three cases with conditions to include no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no driving without a valid driver's license. Def. on probation hold. Def. has nothing to say as to bond. The Court orders $10,000 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
